title: Sans Serif, Quite condensed, Looks modern to me. I think it quite a unique looking font
content:
Hi,  
Can anyone help me with the name of the font used on the Words "State by State"?  
Much appreciated in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826035229im_/http:/typophile.com/files/18b2044313c7a426f3de467d5adcf5c9_4289.jpg)
author: Rawshock Design

comments.content:
Not matching perfectly but very close to [American Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826035229/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/american-gothic) (mixing upper/lowercases mainly to get / [w](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826035229/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/american-gothic/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/280352/111)).  
 [Got the answer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826035229/http:/welovetypography.com/post/7093). That's [WPA Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826035229/http:/fontstruct.com/fontstructions/embed/14740) by Stephen Coles.
